Python API

pioner.back

Backend, server part. Everything related to Raspberry Pi & PyTango

daq_device.py module

class pioner.back.daq_device.DaqDeviceHandler(params: DaqParams)

Class to handle connection to DAQ device with preset parameters. On initiallization, looks for connected devices only via USB interface. Only one device is expected to be connected.

Parameters:

params (DaqParams) – Basic parameters to initialize connection to DAQ device.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If no devices connected, logs and raises error

connect()

Basic method to connect to DAQ device only with USB interface. Only one device expected to be connected. Logs success/unsuccess result.

disconnect()

Basic method to disconnect DAQ device. Logs result.

get() → uldaq.DaqDevice

Provides explicit access to uldaq.daq_device.

Returns:

uldaq.DaqDevice class with properties and methods, provided by uldaq library.

Return type:

class

get_ai_device() → uldaq.AiDevice

Provides explicit access to uldaq.ai_device.

Returns:

uldaq.AiDevice class with properties and methods, provided by uldaq library.

Return type:

class

get_ao_device() → uldaq.AoDevice

Provides explicit access to uldaq.ao_device.

Returns:

uldaq.AoDevice class with properties and methods, provided by uldaq library.

Return type:

class

get_descriptor() → uldaq.DaqDeviceDescriptor

Provides explicit access to the descriptor of connected DAQ device.

Returns:

A class uldaq.DaqDeviceDescriptor with the following properties of connected device: product_name, product_id, property dev_interface, property dev_string, property unique_id

Return type:

class

is_connected() → bool

Provides explicit access to the connection status of DAQ device.

Returns:

True if connected, False if not

Return type:

bool

quit()

Basic method to disconnect and release DAQ device. Logs result.

release()

Basic method to release DAQ device. Logs result.

reset()

Basic method to reset DAQ device. Logs result.

try_connect(timeout: int = 60, sleep_time: int = 1)

Uses basic method connect to connect to DAQ device via USB interface using timeout. No action if device is already connected. Logs success/unsuccess result.

Parameters:

  • timeout (int) – Timeout to give up connecting in seconds. By default = 60

  • sleep_time (int) – Sleeptime between connection attempts in seconds. By default = 1

Raises:

TimeoutError – If device can’t be found via selected interface, logs and raises error

class pioner.back.daq_device.DaqParams

General class to represent main DAQ parameters. Deafult paramteres cannot be used to initialize uldaq.DaqDevice, they need to be parsed from file or specified manually.

Parameters:

  • interface_type (uldaq.InterfaceType) – USB = 1; BLUETOOTH = 2; ETHERNET = 4; ANY = 7. Refer to uldaq documentation. By default, uldaq.InterfaceType.ANY is used.

  • connection_code (int) – The connection code becomes active after cycling power to the device or calling uldaq.DaqDevice.reset(). This function only applies to DAQ Ethernet devices. By default -1 used.

ao_data_generators.py module

class pioner.back.ao_data_generators.PulseDataGenerator(channel_voltages: dict, duration: int, low_channel: int, high_channel: int)

Class to generate linear buffer from dictionary. Used in pulse mode. Unused channels in selected channel range are being set to 0.

Parameters:

  • channel_voltages (dict) – Dictionary should have the following format: {'ch0': float, 'ch3': float}.

  • duration (int) – Voltage pulse duration in seconds.

  • low_channel (int) – First D/A channel in the scan.

  • high_channel (int) – Last D/A channel in the scan.

get_buffer() → List[float]

Provides explicit access to generated buffer.

Returns:

List of floats - 1D buffer array

Return type:

[float]

class pioner.back.ao_data_generators.ScanDataGenerator(voltage_profiles: dict, low_channel: int, high_channel: int)

Class to generate linar buffer from dictionary. Used in scan mode with applying custom profiles to different channels. Unused channels in selected channel range are being set to 0.

Parameters:

  • voltage_profiles (dict) – Dictionary should have the following format: {'ch0': [float], 'ch3': [float]}.

  • low_channel (int) – First D/A channel in the scan.

  • high_channel (int) – Last D/A channel in the scan.

get_buffer() → [<class 'float'>]

Provides explicit access to generated buffer.

Returns:

List of floats - 1D buffer array

Return type:

[float]

ao_device.py module

class pioner.back.ao_device.AoDeviceHandler(ao_device_from_daq: uldaq.AoDevice, params: AoParams)

Wraps the analog output uldaq.AoDevice. Initializes AO DAQ device and all parameters.

Parameters:

  • ao_device_from_daq (uldaq.AoDevice) – A class instance, obtained from uldaq.DaqDevice.

  • params (AoParams) – A class instance, containing all needed analog output parameters parsed from JSON or specified manually.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the DAQ device doesn’t support analog output or hardware paced analog output.

get() → uldaq.AoDevice

Provides explicit access to the uldaq.AoDevice.

Returns:

uldaq.AoDevice class with properties and methods, provided by uldaq library.

Return type:

class

iso_mode(ao_channel: int, voltage: float) → float

Sets voltage to the specified AO channel.

Note

The voltage remains on the channel until DAQ board released and disconnected.

Parameters:

  • ao_channel (int) – AO channel number (usually from 0 to 3).

  • voltage (float) – Voltage value, usually from 0 to 10.

Returns:

Scan rate in points per second

Return type:

float

scan(ao_buffer: List[float]) → float

Launches analog output scan with current parameters from AoParams. Voltage data (voltage profiles) is taken from assigned buffer - an 1D array of size number_of_channels * samples_per_channel.

For example, in case of using:

AO ch0: [1.0, 2.0, 3.0] & AO ch1: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] & AO ch2: [0.5, 1.5, 2.5]

ao_buffer should be: [1.0, 0.0, 0.5, 2.0, 0.0, 1.5, 3.0, 0.0, 2.5]

Parameters:

ao_buffer (List[float]) – A buffer with double precision floating point sample values.

Returns:

Scan rate in points per second

Return type:

float

status() → Tuple[uldaq.ScanStatus, uldaq.TransferStatus]

Provides analog output scan and data transfer status

Returns:

(uldaq.ScanStatus, uldaq.TransferStatus) tuple with first element that can be IDLE = 0 or RUNNING = 1. The second element is a class containing properties that define the progress of a scan operation: current_scan_count, current_total_count and current_index.

Return type:

tuple

stop()

Interrupts analog output scan

class pioner.back.ao_device.AoParams

General class to represent main AO DAQ parameters. Deafult paramteres cannot be used to initialize uldaq.AoDevice, they need to be parsed from JSON file or specified manually.

Parameters:

  • sample_rate (int) – Number of D/A samples to output.

  • range_id (uldaq.Range) – Normally 5 for -10 to +10 Volts range. Refer to uldaq for additional info.

  • low_channel (int) – First D/A channel in the scan.

  • high_channel (int) – Last D/A channel in the scan.

  • scan_flags (uldaq.AOutScanFlag) – One or more of the attributes (suitable for bit-wise operations) specifying the conditioning applied to the data. Refer to uldaq for additional info. By default uldaq.AOutScanFlag.DEFAULT flag is used

  • options (uldaq.ScanOption) – One or more of the attributes (suitable for bit-wise operations) specifying the conditioning applied to the data. Refer to uldaq for additional info. By default uldaq.ScanOption.CONTINUOUS option is used

ai_device.py module

class pioner.back.ai_device.AiDeviceHandler(ai_device_from_daq: uldaq.AiDevice, params: AiParams)

Wraps the analog input uldaq.AiDevice. Initializes AI DAQ device, all parameters and buffer to write data.

Parameters:

  • ai_device_from_daq (uldaq.AiDevice) – A class instance, obtained from uldaq.DaqDevice.

  • params (AiParams) – A class instance, containing all needed analog input parameters parsed from JSON or specified manually.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the DAQ device doesn’t support analog outinput put or hardware paced analog input.

get() → uldaq.AiDevice

Provides explicit access to the uldaq.AiDevice.

Returns:

uldaq.AiDevice class with properties and methods, provided by uldaq library.

Return type:

class

get_buffer() → List[float]

Provides explicit access to buffer with current obtained A/D values. Buffer is an 1D array of size number_of_channels * samples_per_channel.

For example, in case of using channels 0-3, if ao_buffer is: [1.0, 0.0, 0.5, 2.0, 0.0, 1.5, 3.0, 0.0, 2.5], data from each channel looks like: AO ch1: [1.0, 2.0, 3.0] & AO ch2: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] & AO ch3: [0.5, 1.5, 2.5]

Returns:

Returns an array of double precision floating point sample values.

Return type:

List[float]

scan() → float

Launches analog input scan with current parameters from AiParams.

Returns:

Scan rate in points per second

Return type:

float

status() → Tuple[uldaq.ScanStatus, uldaq.TransferStatus]

Provides analog output scan and data transfer status.

Returns:

(uldaq.ScanStatus, uldaq.TransferStatus) tuple with first element that can be IDLE = 0 or RUNNING = 1. The second element is a class containing properties that define the progress of a scan operation: current_scan_count, current_total_count and current_index.

Return type:

tuple

stop()

Interrupts analog input scan.

class pioner.back.ai_device.AiParams

General class to represent main AI DAQ parameters. Deafult paramteres cannot be used to initialize uldaq.AiDevice, they need to be parsed from JSON file or specified manually.

Parameters:

  • sample_rate (int) – A/D sample rate in samples per channel per second.

  • range_id (uldaq.Range) – Normally 5 for -10 to +10 Volts range. Refer to uldaq for additional info.

  • low_channel (int) – First A/D channel in the scan.

  • high_channel (int) – Last A/D channel in the scan.

  • input_mode (uldaq.AiInputMode) – The input mode of the specified channels. Refer to uldaq for additional info. By default uldaq.AiInputMode.SINGLE_ENDED flag is used

  • scan_flags (uldaq.AOutScanFlag) – One or more of the attributes (suitable for bit-wise operations) specifying the conditioning applied to the data before it is returned. Refer to uldaq for additional info. By default uldaq.AOutScanFlag.DEFAULT flag is used

  • options (uldaq.ScanOption) – One or more of the attributes (suitable for bit-wise operations) specifying the conditioning applied to the data before it is returned. Refer to uldaq for additional info. By default uldaq.ScanOption.CONTINUOUS option is used

experiment_manager.py module

class pioner.back.experiment_manager.ExperimentManager(daq_device_handler: DaqDeviceHandler, settings: BackSettings)

Class to control experiment, manage AO/AI and buffer handle.

Parameters:

  • daq_device_handler (pioner.daq_device.DaqDeviceHandler) – DaqDeviceHandler class instance to handle connection to DAQ device. Parameters of DAQ device should be preset from settings file while initializing of DaqDeviceHandler class instance

  • settings (pioner.shared.BackSettings) – BackSettings class instance after parsing of the configuration file with all necessary acquisition parameters.

ai_continuous(ai_channels: List[int], do_save_data: bool)

Method to launch AI in continuous scan mode. Reading is made with circular buffer, devided in two halfs. Buffer length = 1 s. The first 0.5 s data points (low half buffer) are being read while new data points are being recorded to the second 0.5 s buffer (high half buffer). Contrary, when writing points to the first 0.5 s cycle buffer (low half buffer), data is read from the second part of the buffer (high half buffer). Uses pioner.back.ai_device.AiDeviceHandler.scan to start aquisition.

Parameters:

  • ai_channels (List[int]) – AI channels list to read (usually from 0 to 15).

  • do_save_data (bool) – if True, saves all the data to separate *.hdf files. Used for fast finite AI/AO scans. If if False, saves all the data to one *.hdf file, continuousely overwriting data. Used for long or infinite AI/AO scans. Data can be accessed later using pioner.back.experiment_manager.get_ai_data method.

ai_continuous_stop()

Method to stop AI during continuous scan, using pioner.back.ai_device.AiDeviceHandler.stop.

ao_scan(voltage_profiles)

Method to launch AO scan with predefined voltage profiles on channels. Makes AO buffer using pioner.back.ao_data_generators.ScanDataGenerator and AoDeviceHandler instance using pared settings. To launch the scan uses pioner.back.ao_device.AoDeviceHandler.scan

Parameters:

voltage_profiles (dict) – Dictionary should have the following format: {'ch0': [float], 'ch3': [float]}.

ao_set(ao_channel, voltage)

Method to set and hold voltage on selected AO channel, uses pioner.back.ao_device.AoDeviceHandler.iso_mode

Note

The voltage remains on the channel until DAQ board released and disconnected.

Parameters:

  • ao_channel (int) – AO channel number (usually from 0 to 3).

  • voltage (float) – Voltage value, usually from 0 to 10.

get_ai_data() → DataFrame

Reads raw buffer from *.hdf file. Note: Pandas l ibrary is used to read / write datasets. Array in file is already transformed from 1D to 2D array.

Returns:

Returns Pandas array: ['channel #':[float] ... 'channel #':[float]]

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

fastheat.py module

class pioner.back.fastheat.FastHeat(daq_device_handler: DaqDeviceHandler, settings: BackSettings, time_temp_volt_tables: dict, calibration: Calibration, ai_channels: List[int], FAST_HEAT_CUSTOM_FLAG=False)

Class to launch fast heating with sampling rate up to 100000 points per second for each AI channel. After scan is finished, raw data is transfromed with respect to calibration and saved to file (only data from specified AI channels)

Parameters:

  • daq_device_handler (pioner.daq_device.DaqDeviceHandler) – DaqDeviceHandler class instance to handle connection to DAQ device. Parameters of DAQ device should be preset from settings file while initializing of DaqDeviceHandler class instance

  • settings (pioner.shared.BackSettings) – BackSettings class instance after parsing of the configuration file with all necessary acquisition parameters.

  • calibration (pioner.shared.calibration.Calibration) – Calibration class instance, parsed from *.json calibration file with pioner.shared.calibration.Calibration.read method

  • time_temp_volt_tables (dict) – Dictionary should have the following structure: {"ch0": {"time":[float], "temp":[float]}, "ch1": {"time":[float], "volt":[float]}, .... If “volt” is used, no calibration will be applied. If “temp” is used, calibration will be applied.

  • ai_channels (List[int]) – AI channels list to read. Only data from specified AI channels will be saved. For normal fast heating it is [0,1,3,4,5]

  • FAST_HEAT_CUSTOM_FLAG (bool) – By default is False. If False, calibration coefficients will be applied. True is used only for expert mode.

arm()

Method to prepare scan. It interpolates vlotage profiles and applies calibration coefficients to transform target temperature on heaters to voltage on AO channels.

is_armed() → bool

Method to check if fast heat mode is prepared and voltage profiles are correct.

Returns:

Returns True or False depending on state.

Return type:

bool

run()

Method to launch scan after preparation step (arming). Uses methods pioner.back.experiment_manager.ExperimentManager.ao_scan and pioner.back.experiment_manager.ExperimentManager.ai_continuous to launch AO and AI scans. Saves experimental data after applying calibration and adds experiment information to *.hdf file.

iso_mode.py module

class pioner.back.iso_mode.IsoMode(daq_device_handler: DaqDeviceHandler, settings: BackSettings, chan_temp_volt: dict, calibration: Calibration)

Class to launch isothermal mode with predefined settings without saving AI data. The applied temperature / voltage will be maintained util user sets it manually to 0 (could be done with the same IsoMode methods) or disconnects DAQ device.

Parameters:

  • daq_device_handler (pioner.daq_device.DaqDeviceHandler) – DaqDeviceHandler class instance to handle connection to DAQ device. Parameters of DAQ device should be preset from settings file while initializing of DaqDeviceHandler class instance

  • settings (pioner.shared.BackSettings) – BackSettings class instance after parsing of the configuration file with all necessary acquisition parameters.

  • calibration (pioner.shared.calibration.Calibration) – Calibration class instance, parsed from *.json calibration file with pioner.shared.calibration.Calibration.read method

  • chan_temp_volt (dict) – Dictionary should have the following structure: {"ch0": {"temp":[float]}, "ch1": {"volt":[float]}, .... If “volt” is used, no calibration will be applied. If “temp” is used, calibration will be applied.

ai_stop()

Method to stop AI using method pioner.back.experiment_manager.ExperimentManager.ai_continuous_stop

arm() → [<class 'int'>, <class 'float'>]

Method to prepare isotherm. Applies calibration coefficients to transform target temperature on heaters to voltage on AO channels.

is_armed() → bool

Method to check if isothermal mode is prepared and voltage values are correct.

Returns:

Returns True or False depending on state.

Return type:

bool

run(do_ai: bool)

Method to start isotherm after preparation step (arming). Uses methods pioner.back.experiment_manager.ExperimentManager.ao_set and pioner.back.experiment_manager.ExperimentManager.ai_continuous to launch AO and AI scans. Does not saves experimental data.

nanocontrol_tango.py module

class pioner.back.nanocontrol_tango.NanoControl(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)

General class to control DAQ device using TANGO server. To launch server manually use the coomand python nanocontrol_tango.py NanoControl

apply_calibration()

Tango command method to apply custom temperature-voltage calibration. Reads calibration coefficients from *.json file.

apply_default_calibration()

Tango command method to apply default temperature-voltage calibration. Reads calibration coefficients from *.json file.

arm_fast_heat(time_temp_volt_tables_str)

Tango command method to prepare (arm) fast heating profile. Makes pioner.back.fastheat.FastHeat instance and uses pioner.back.fastheat.FastHeat.arm method. Logs result.

Parameters:

time_temp_volt_tables_str (str) – Dictionary time_temp_volt_tables, accepted by pioner.back.fastheat.FastHeat should be converted into string before passing as an argument.

arm_iso_mode(chan_temp_volt_str)

Tango command method to prepare (arm) isotherm / isovoltage mode. Makes pioner.back.iso_mode.IsoMode instance and uses pioner.back.iso_mode.IsoMode.arm method. Logs result.

Parameters:

chan_temp_volt_str (str) – Dictionary chan_temp_volt, accepted by pioner.back.iso_mode.IsoModes should be converted into string before passing as an argument.

disconnect()

Tango command method to disconnsect DAQ device using method disconnect of pioner.back.daq_device.DaqDeviceHandler. Logs result.

get_current_calibration()

Tango pipe method to get current calibration as dictionary.

Returns:

Uses pioner.shared.calibration.Calibration.get_str and transforms string to dictionary. Use key calib to acces calibration

Return type:

dict

get_info()

Tango pipe method to get information of the software.

Returns:

{developer:'str', contact:'str', model:'str', version_number:'float'}

Return type:

dict

get_sample_rate()

Tango pipe method to get current applied sample rate.

Returns:

Use key sr to acces sampling rate

Return type:

dict

init_device()

Method to initialize the server and apply default configuration settings.

  • sets path for logging

  • sets path for data saving

  • applies default calibration

  • parses *json settings file

  • makes pioner.back.daq_device.DaqDeviceHandler instance with parsed settings

load_calibration(str_calib)

Tango command method to load temperature-voltage calibration. Loads calibration coefficients from string and writes them to *.json file.

Parameters:

str_calib (str) – Calibration coefficients in string format. For more information refer to pioner.shared.calibration.Calibration.get_str

reset_sample_scan_rate()

Tango command method to reset sample rate, the value is parsed from *.json settings file.

run_fast_heat()

Tango command method to apply (run) fast heating profile. Checks if fast heating is prepared correctly (armed) and uses pioner.back.fastheat.FastHeat.run method. Logs result.

run_iso_mode()

Tango command method to apply (run) fast isotherm / isovoltage mode. Checks if iso mode is prepared correctly (armed) and uses pioner.back.iso_mode.IsoMode.run method. Logs result.

set_connection()

Tango command method to set connection to avaliable DAQ device using method try_connect of pioner.back.daq_device.DaqDeviceHandler. Logs result even in case of error.

set_sample_scan_rate(scan_rate)

Tango command method to set sample rate. Logs if success.

Parameters:

scan_rate (int) – Sample rate in points per second.

—
